channel.title: Theiving stalls give more money?
channel.description: Hi, i have a pi source and i was wondering. how do i make my thieving stalls give more money. i have 4 of them thanks :D.

item.title: Theiving stalls give more money?
item.dc:creator: @Danielplanto Danielplanto
item.description:
@Danielplanto wrote:

Im not sure how PI works, I am using a Delta/Devo combination. Closer to Devo, but this is what my stalls look like (Client.java):

if(objectID == 2562){ TheifStall("gem stall", "and recieve 200k", 80, 1000*playerLevel[17], 995, 200000, 0x340); } if(objectID == 2560){ TheifStall("silk stall", "and recieve 10k", 1, 500*playerLevel[17], 995, 10000, 0x340); } if(objectID == 2565){ TheifStall("silver stall", "and recieve 100k", 50, 300*playerLevel[17], 995, 100000, 0x340); } if(objectID == 4877){ TheifStall("magic stall", "and recieve 500k", 99, 5000*playerLevel[17], 995, 500000, 0x340); } if(objectID == 4878){ TheifStall("scimitar stall", "and recieve 1m", 125, 10000*playerLevel[17], 995, 1000000, 0x340); } if(objectID == 4875){ TheifStall("food stall", "and recieve 5m", 150, 2500*playerLevel[17], 995, 5000000, 0x340); } if(objectID == 4876 && playerRights >= 2){ TheifStall("general stall", "and recieve 50m", 1, 100000*playerLevel[17], 995, 50000000, 0x340); }
In which case you would change the 995, ###### to whatever you wanted.
Explanation

if(objectID == 4875){

ID of stall you are stealing from

TheifStall(

Tells you what to do.

"general stall",

names the stall in the message it sends you.

"and receive 5m",

finishes the message.

150,

Tells required level.

2500*playerLeve[17],

tells how much exp it will give based on character level.

995,

tells item it gives.

5000000,

tells amount of that item.

0x340); }

Finishes the code and gives emote for thieving from the stall.

Read full topic

item.title: Theiving stalls give more money?
item.dc:creator: @EmulousGuru EmulousGuru
item.description:
@EmulousGuru wrote:

Edit the amount of cash received in ActionHandler class in the switch(objectType) statement under the firstClickObject method.
